name: Acute Diverticulitis with Peridiverticular Abscess
chief_complaint: Severe left lower abdominal pain and fever for 2 days
treatment: Elective colectomy after resolution for recurrent cases
prognosis: Good with prompt treatment, but 30% recurrence rate within 5 years
description: Inflammation of diverticula in the sigmoid colon with localized abscess formation, typically occurring in patients with pre-existing diverticulosis. The condition represents a complication of diverticular disease requiring prompt medical or surgical intervention.
